common_issues.title: Pieces OS account linking and login issues across platforms
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with account linking (primarily Google and GitHub) and login failures on Windows and Linux. Problems included infinite loading during authentication, single account linking limitations, and HTTP 500 errors. Solutions involved support team intervention, manual account linking, software updates, and log analysis. Some issues were resolved quickly, while others required ongoing investigation.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User johnkennyuk is experiencing issues linking their GitHub and Google accounts.
* The current account linking flow is not user-friendly and is being replaced in mid-February.
* The user's accounts were originally registered separately due to a bug in the application.
* The user wants to keep their Google account as the main account and link their GitHub account to it.

**Problems Identified:**

* The current account linking flow is not straightforward.
* The user's accounts were registered separately causing linking issues.
* There is a capitalization issue between the user's Google and GitHub email addresses.
* The user accidentally linked their accounts in the wrong order using the new auth app.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark from Pieces offered to meet with the user to manually link their accounts.
* Mark identified and adjusted the capitalization issue in the user's emails.
* Mark reset the user's GitHub account to allow relinking.
* The new auth app was released, replacing the old and less user-friendly linking flow.
* Mark offered to help the user relink their accounts after they accidentally linked them in the wrong order.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user is waiting for the new auth app to be fully implemented.
* The user's accounts were temporarily relinked by Mark.
* The user accidentally relinked their accounts in the wrong order using the new auth app.
* Mark offered to help the user relink their accounts again.

**Additional Notes:**

* The new auth app is still under development and is expected to be released in early/mid-March.
* The user's issues are likely related to the bug in the earlier versions of the application.
* The new auth app will address the account linking issues and allow for more flexibility in linking different types of accounts.

related_issues.title: Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
related_issues.text:
Stuck at https://authentication.pieces.services/
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After updating pieces to latest version, I was loggged out (This was part of the update, which I saw in the update / release notes.). But when I try to log in, always end up at https://authentication.pieces.services/ without moving forward. that page keep loading and nothing happens.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points Raised:

* Users (waseem852, AlexanderSLoburev, NishDJ, freccon) reported experiencing infinite loading issues while trying to connect their Google accounts after updating Pieces OS to version 11.3.0.
* The connection attempt was through the Pieces Tool Bar and the Pieces Desktop app.

### Problems Identified:

* Upon logging out due to the update, users were unable to link their Google accounts.
* The authentication process infinitely loaded on the page https://authentication.pieces.services/.
* The issue was affecting Windows 11 users.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* Mark-at-pieces (support team member) suggested logging in from the Pieces Toolbar "Connect Account" button.
* He also requested users to share screen recordings and support logs for debugging.
* The support team identified and fixed the issue within a few hours.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* The authentication process was fixed by the support team.
* Users who were experiencing the issue confirmed that it was resolved.
* The issue was closed.

## Additional Notes:

* Users were able to link their Google accounts successfully after the fix.
* The response time and quick resolution by the support team were appreciated by the users.

related_issues.title: OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
## GitHub Issue Summary: Auth Issue on Linux

**Key points raised:**

* @utrack reported an issue with authentication not working on their Linux system.
* They provided a link to their calendar for debugging purposes.
* @nathan-courtney-pieces requested the full log file and details of the Linux distribution being used.

**Problems identified:**

* Authentication on Linux was not functioning properly.
* The cause of the problem was unclear.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @nathan-courtney-pieces asked for additional information to diagnose the problem, including:
    * Full log file
    * Linux distribution and version
* @utrack provided the requested information, including log files and confirmation that they were using Arch Linux rolling.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue was still under investigation at the time of the last update.
* No solution had been implemented yet.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation took place on April 17th and 18th, 2025. 
* The issue was automatically assigned to the "Pieces" team for further investigation.
* @utrack was advised to consult existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel for additional support.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Installation and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported issues with Pieces OS and Desktop App installation and launch on Windows and Linux. Problems include invalid port errors, database corruption, missing folders, and HTTP 500 errors during login. Suggested solutions involve using WinGet with admin rights, checking for database corruption, verifying folder existence, and examining OS logs.  Pieces support is actively investigating and releasing patches to address these issues.

related_issues.title: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Latest from 17032025 (can't find it)

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi I am stuck at the initial stages. Where the desktop app is being initialized. I am at verify dependency connections and it says unable to open pieces core services. "FormatException: Invalid Port (at character 18) http://127.0.0.1:null/connect.

It might be an antivirus stopping it. I am not sure. But I have restarted and reinstalled to no effect.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* SherlockSol reported an issue with Pieces Desktop not launching on their Windows PC.
* They provided logs and system information for troubleshooting.
* Another user, uzaxirr, reported experiencing the same issue.
* zedevmed identified the problem as the lack of admin rights during installation and provided a solution using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces Desktop not launching on Windows PC.
* Difficulty in reproducing the issue.
* The .exe installer not requesting admin rights, leading to port binding problems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Sharing logs and system information for troubleshooting.
* Video call for live troubleshooting.
* Using WinGet in an elevated PowerShell session to install PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop app.
* Promoting the MSIX or winget installation method for both POS and PFD in the documentation.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The cause of the issue has been identified.
* A workaround using WinGet has been suggested.
* The documentation will be updated to reflect the recommended installation method.
* Live troubleshooting with zedevmed is scheduled.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue persists for some users.
* Further investigation and testing are needed to fully resolve the problem.

### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The latest version doesn't start. 

Here is the log in com.pieces.os/production/Support/logs:

[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting OS_Server!
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting EnvConf
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.605235  Starting DeploymentInfo
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Number: 218
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Tag: 11.3.0
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Branch: 11.3.0
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  SHA1: a59a1f114c021e83a6f42e696223dba9a670faa2
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  WinDeployType: exe
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Channel : production
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.619237  Process ID: 2076
[D]  Setting Url Protocol Scheme for Inno Setup/ Squirrel Installs
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.625235  Logging to file: C:\Users\antoine\Documents\com.pieces.os\production\Support/logs/log-04122025.txt
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Copying the vocab file to the data directory
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Successfully copied the vocab file
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.634236  Starting OS
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.660235  Starting OS
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.660235  Starting UI
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  UI#builder, hasData: false, hasError: false
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  stateStream#onListen
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#boot
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.665241  OS#attach
[38;5;12m[I][0m  initializeDataSingletons
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.991237  Created our Tagify Files Locally.
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:01.991237  User added tagify files now exist.
[D]  Setting WinToast Dismissed Callback
[D]  Setting WinToast Dismissed Callback
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 1ba7ab308a4b470ab996b360cc956398
[38;5;12m[I][0m  _controller.addError Unable to open database due to corruption LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #0      InternalCouchBaseDatabases.initializeCouchbase (package:database_facade/couchbase/singletons/internal_databases.dart)
<asynchronous suspension>
#1      OS.initializeDataSingletons (package:os_server/os.dart:909)
<asynchronous suspension>
#2      OS.boot (package:os_server/os.dart:652)
<asynchronous suspension>
#3      OS._controller.<anonymous closure>.<anonymous closure>.<anonymous closure> (package:os_server/os.dart:275)
<asynchronous suspension>

[D]  Sentry Error Event: 2a48d07355694369b880fa84ef743112
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 9f79ad8b81a1493c955f24b3cf97db7e
[D]  2025-04-12T16:16:05.956756  UI#builder, hasData: false, hasError: true
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: timeout
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: timeout
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: onNotificationDismissed: 
[D]  Windows: Notification Timeout: Went into side panel
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User antoine79 was having problems with the latest version of Pieces OS (11.3.1).
* The database failed to launch due to corruption and an initialization error.
* User manually created the missing subfolder `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2` which revealed a new error: AVX2 instruction set was not supported.

**Problems Identified:**

* Database corruption.
* Missing subfolder in the installation directory.
* CPU does not support the required AVX2 instruction set for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces Support investigated and identified the core issues.
* They are pushing a fix that accounts for both cases: database corruption and missing subfolder.
* A new version, 11.3.2, is released with the fix for both cases.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved and closed.
* Version 11.3.2 of Pieces OS should be used.

**Additional Information:**

* User's machine has an Intel i7-2600 CPU that supports AVX but not AVX2, creating an incompatibility with the extension.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Crash/Startup Failure Due to Database Corruption
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported Pieces OS crashing or failing to start on macOS and Windows due to database corruption errors.  A common error message was "LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized." Issues were often resolved by updating to the latest version (e.g., 11.3.2), which included fixes for database corruption and missing subfolders.  One user resolved the issue by manually creating a missing subfolder. In some cases, CPU incompatibility with the AVX2 instruction set caused issues.

related_issues.title: Application Crash on Startup
related_issues.text:
Application Crash on Startup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Upon launching the application, it crashes immediately with an error message stating "Unexpected error occurred." This issue started occurring after updating to version 11.0.0. The crash seems to be related to the new plugin integration. Steps to reproduce:


## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Subject:** App Crashing on macOS 12.3 (M2 MacBook Air)

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `moazzem-pixel` reported the app crashing on their macOS 12.3 device (M2 MacBook Air).
* They provided details about their operating system, hardware, installed plugins, crash logs, and the previous version that was working.
* They expected the app to launch without crashing and function as expected.

**Problems Identified:**

* The app was crashing on the user's device.
* This might be related to a known issue mentioned in another support ticket (#686).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* `mark-at-pieces` suggested checking if the issue is similar to the one reported in #686.
* If not, they recommended scheduling a support call.
* Ultimately, the issue was resolved by updating to the latest version (11.3.2).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is resolved with the latest version (11.3.2).
* Users are asked to reopen the ticket if the issue persists after updating.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User antoine79 was having problems with the latest version of Pieces OS (11.3.1).
* The database failed to launch due to corruption and an initialization error.
* User manually created the missing subfolder `com.pieces.os\production\Pieces\couchbase.cblite2` which revealed a new error: AVX2 instruction set was not supported.

**Problems Identified:**

* Database corruption.
* Missing subfolder in the installation directory.
* CPU does not support the required AVX2 instruction set for CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces Support investigated and identified the core issues.
* They are pushing a fix that accounts for both cases: database corruption and missing subfolder.
* A new version, 11.3.2, is released with the fix for both cases.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved and closed.
* Version 11.3.2 of Pieces OS should be used.

**Additional Information:**

* User's machine has an Intel i7-2600 CPU that supports AVX but not AVX2, creating an incompatibility with the extension.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS doesn't start due to database corruption: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized. #686
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

Early Access Program

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS fails to start because it is unable to open the database due to corruption. The error message displayed is: LateInitializationError: Field 'database' has not been initialized.

Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to start Pieces OS on macOS.
Observe the error message indicating database corruption.
Expected Behavior: I expected Pieces OS to start normally and access the database without any issues.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Point:** User @moazzem-pixel reported an issue with Pieces OS failing to start due to database corruption.

**Problem:** Pieces OS is unable to open the database due to corruption, preventing the application from starting.

**Solutions:**
* @mark-at-pieces suggests continuing the conversation in a duplicate issue (#686) to consolidate discussion and avoid redundancy.

**Current Status:** 
* The conversation has been moved to issue #686.
* The original issue has been closed.

**Outcome:** 
* The user is directed to the relevant issue for further discussion and resolution.
